page.title: 01OVERVIEW LACKHAM DERRY HILL
page.content: This area is an essentially{rural area dominated by an escarpment running north-south through the centre of the block. There are isolated pockets of habitation which look to the villages of{Lacock}to the south west and{Derry {Hill}to the north east for community contact. The upper reaches of the Bristol Avon runs through the block providing a haven for{wild life. The{National Trust}is evident in this area with its ownership of two tracts of land which are preserved to allow superb views over the Avon valley. The main sources of employment are {farming and tourism}but the area also acts as a{dormitory}for industry and commerce in nearby towns. ther is a large{agriculture college}at Lackham.
